column4: It is easier to set up DOS first, then run the Linux installer -- Grub should find it automatically

DOS will have to be on your boot partition, as I recall, and I think it has a limit on the number of cylinders you can use for its partition (it has been a decade at least since I used MS-DOS in any form)
Gotta put the kid to bed, then we'll see what we can do.
can you put your /boot/grub/menu.lst on the pastebin?
